qas.question: Which century did the US incorporate Spanish?
Which acquisition reinforced the Spanish language?
What year did Puerto Rico become a state?
Which countries came in major emigrations to the US?
What grows in the US as the Spanish population increases?

plausible_answers.text: emigration from Mexico, Cuba, El Salvador and elsewhere in Hispanic America to the United States

qas.question: What strengthened the role of the English language in the the country?
Who increases the use and importance of American English in the United States?

context: After the incorporation of these states to the United States in the first half of the <b0_0>19th century<b0_0/>, the <b5_0>Spanish language<b5_0/> was later reinforced in the country by the acquisition of <b1_0>Puerto Rico<b1_0/> in <b2_0><b6_0>1898<b6_0/><b2_0/>. Later waves of <b8_0>emigration from <b3_0>Mexico, Cuba, El Salvador<b3_0/> and elsewhere in Hispanic America to the United States<b8_0/> beginning in the second half of the 19th century to the present-day have strengthened the role of the <b4_0>Spanish language<b4_0/> in the country. Today, <b7_0><b9_0>Hispanics<b9_0/><b7_0/> are one of the fastest growing demographics in the United States, thus increasing the use and importance of American Spanish in the United States.
